decks.notes: This deck focuses on controlling the game through countering spells, removing threats, and card advantage. It utilizes cards like Cryptic Command, Snapcaster Mage, and Search for Azcanta to out-value opponents while maintaining control of the board. Nahiri, the Harbinger and Torrential Gearhulk provide additional threats and utility. The deck includes a mix of removal, counterspells, and card draw to answer a variety of threats and stay ahead in the resource game. The manabase is designed to consistently hit the deck's powerful spells and enable its control strategy.

This UW Control deck focuses on utilizing a combination of counterspells, removal spells, card draw, and win conditions to control the game and outvalue the opponent. By efficiently answering threats with cards like Cryptic Command, Path to Exile, and Lightning Bolt, while also generating card advantage with Search for Azcanta and Snapcaster Mage, this deck aims to stall the game until it can close out with powerful finishers like Torrential Gearhulk or Celestial Colonnade. The deck's versatility allows it to adapt to various matchups and grind out wins through resource management and careful decision-making.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively use cards like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while also utilizing the Death's Shadow mechanic to capitalize on having a low life total. The deck also includes efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Dismember to control the board, as well as cards like Snapcaster Mage and Kolaghan's Command for added value. The deck aims to quickly apply pressure on the opponent while maintaining control of the game through disruption and removal spells.

This deck focuses on generating a large amount of mana quickly through spells such as Pyretic Ritual and Manamorphose, while utilizing cards like Baral, Chief of Compliance and Goblin Electromancer to reduce the cost of spells. The goal is to cast a high storm count spell like Grapeshot multiple times in one turn to deal lethal damage to the opponent. Cards like Past in Flames allow for spell recursion, while Gifts Ungiven provides card selection and flexibility in finding key combo pieces. The deck aims to win in a single explosive turn.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy using Human creatures. By utilizing cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Thalia's Lieutenant to disrupt the opponent's plays, combined with powerful creatures like Mantis Rider and Champion of the Parish, the deck aims to quickly build a board presence and deal damage efficiently. Cards like Aether Vial and Noble Hierarch help to accelerate the deck's game plan, while Reflector Mage and Kitesail Freebooter provide additional disruption and control options.

The core strategy of this Selesnya Aggro deck is to use efficient creatures like Tireless Tracker, Knight of the Reliquary, and Voice of Resurgence to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes powerful utility creatures like Eternal Witness and Qasali Pridemage along with key land destruction spells like Tectonic Edge and Ghost Quarter to disrupt the opponent's game plan. With mana ramp from Noble Hierarch and Birds of Paradise, along with card advantage from Courser of Kruphix and Collected Company, this deck aims to apply consistent pressure and outvalue the opponent in the mid to late game.

The key concept of this control - Big Red deck is built around the strategic use of control cards and powerful red spells. The deck focuses on locking down the opponent's resources with cards like Blood Moon and Relic of Progenitus, while also dealing damage with efficient removal spells like Skred and Lightning Bolt. The deck also features strong finishers like Stormbreath Dragon and Pia and Kiran Nalaar. Overall, the deck aims to control the game through disruption and removal, while making use of big red spells to close out the game.

The deck focuses on assembling the combo of either Kiki-Jiki, Mirror Breaker and Deceiver Exarch or Pestermite to create infinite creature tokens or untap Kiki-Jiki for repeated activations. To support the combo, the deck includes counterspells like Remand and Cryptic Command, along with removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Electrolyze. Serum Visions and Opt help with card selection and consistency, while Blood Moon can disrupt opponents' mana bases. Snapcaster Mage provides value by recasting crucial spells from the graveyard. The deck aims to control the game until it can safely execute its combo for the win.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize low-cost burn spells and efficient creatures to deal direct damage to the opponent as quickly as possible. By leveraging powerful red spells like Rift Bolt, Lava Spike, and Lightning Bolt, in combination with creatures like Monastery Swiftspear, Goblin Guide, and Eidolon of the Great Revel, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with early aggression and prevent them from stabilizing. The mana base is optimized for consistency and speed, allowing the deck to maintain pressure and close out games before the opponent can establish their game plan.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with spells and creatures, enabling the player to cast a large Death's Shadow early in the game. By using cards like Opt, Street Wraith, and Thought Scour to draw and fill the graveyard, and Stubborn Denial to protect Death's Shadow, the deck aims to deal a large amount of damage to the opponent quickly before they can stabilize. The inclusion of cards like Snapcaster Mage and Kolaghan's Command provide additional utility and flexibility in dealing with threats.

This deck focuses on using cards like Thoughtseize, Serum Visions, and Thought Scour to control the opponent's hand while powering out Death's Shadow as a massive threat early in the game. It also utilizes aggressive creatures like Gurmag Angler and Tasigur, the Golden Fang to apply pressure and close out the game quickly. With a mix of disruption, card draw, and efficient threats, this deck aims to win through aggressive plays and resource denial.

This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy by ramping mana quickly and playing powerful threats such as Arbor Colossus and Hornet Queen. The deck also utilizes planeswalkers like Nissa, Voice of Zendikar and Garruk Wildspeaker to generate additional value and create a wide board presence. The deck includes versatile cards like Primal Command and Summoner's Pact to deal with various situations, along with a toolbox of creatures like Scavenging Ooze and Eternal Witness to provide flexibility and resilience. The overall strategy is to establish a dominant board presence and close out the game quickly.

This deck focuses on playing aggressively with a combination of Human creatures that work well together to disrupt opponents and build up a strong board presence. By utilizing cards like Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play and Cavern of Souls to make them uncounterable, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents quickly with efficient creatures like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Champion of the Parish. The deck also includes disruptive creatures like Reflector Mage and Meddling Mage to control the game and protect its key pieces.

The focus of this deck is to have strong control over the game by using counterspells, removal, and card advantage to outlast the opponent. The deck aims to slow down the opponent's game plan with cards like Spreading Seas and Field of Ruin, while also having access to a variety of versatile counterspells like Negate and Logic Knot. The win condition comes from powerful planeswalkers like Gideon Jura and card advantage engines like Search for Azcanta. Overall, the deck is designed to control the game and grind out a victory through attrition.

The main concept of this deck is to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy by using a blend of counterspells, removal spells, and efficient creatures. By utilizing cards like Cryptic Command, Spell Queller, and Snapcaster Mage, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and maintain control of the game. Geist of Saint Traft provides a fast clock and can pressure the opponent while also protecting itself. The mana base allows for flexibility and consistency in casting spells of varying colors. Overall, the deck focuses on staying ahead in resources and dictating the pace of the game.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing efficient removal spells and counterspells while also maintaining card advantage through cards like Snapcaster Mage and Search for Azcanta. The creatures serve as additional disruption and pressure, allowing for a versatile game plan that can adapt to different matchups. By controlling the board and out-valuing the opponent, the deck aims to grind out a win through incremental advantage and card selection.
